Header.title: ABC University:: Vote 4 Change
Header.paragraph: Today, most American citizens over the age of 18 are entitled to vote in federal and state elections, but voting was not always a default right for all Americans. The United States Constitution, as originally written, did not define specifically who could or could not voteâ€”but it did establish how the new country would vote.
